chapter.title: Working with Tenants
chapter.para: The Tenants view displays the configured tenants. The processes (process units) are responsible for the actual processing of jobs. The processing concept of &dbpi; requires you to assign each process (or process unit) to a tenant. A tenant can be linked to several processing units. However, each process unit is always mapped to only one tenant (for more information on process units, see ). This way you can distinguish between process units for different tenants. After the initial start of &dbpi; you can directly use the predefined tenant DEFAULT. The following actions are supported in the Tenants view:

sect1.title: Creating a Tenant
sect1.para: You can define a new tenant in the web interface.
Proceed as follows to create a new tenant.

step.para: Switch to the Tenants view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The ID field contains mandatory information and is therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while it does not contain a valid value.

step.para: Enter a name for the new tenant in the ID field.
Enter the long name for the new tenant in the Name field.
Enter a brief description of the tenant in the Comment field as required.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new tenant and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new tenant is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the tenant and exit the editing mode without saving the tenant cnfiguration.

sect1.title: Listing Tenants
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the existing tenants in the Tenants view.
The overview table displays the following information for each tenant by default:

listitem.para: Unique identifier or short name of the tenant.
Description of the tenant or comment on the intended use.

sect1.title: Displaying Tenant Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific tenant in the details pane. Compared to the overview table, the details pane contains more information about the selected tenant.
The following information is available in the details pane of a selected tenant:

listitem.para: Unique identifier or short name of the tenant.
Currently, only the value tenants is supported.
Description of the tenant or comment on the intended use.

sect1.title: Modifying a Tenant
sect1.para: You can modify the tenant properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you cannot use this action to modify the tenant ID. To change the ID, create a new tenant with the desired ID (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the properties of a tenant:

step.para: Switch to the Tenants view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: Enter a name for the new tenant in the Name field.
Enter the updated comment on the tenant in the Comment field.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the tenant with the new values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the tenant is displayed with the new values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel editing the tenant and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.para: Besides editing the properties, you can also define new parameters for the application execution or modify existing parameters (for more information, see ).

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Tenants
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple tenants in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected tenants.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected tenants.

step.para: Switch to the Tenants view.
Select at least two tenants from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected tenants.
In the Name field, specify the desired name for all selected tenants.
In the Field 1 field, specify a value for the additional field 1 for all selected tenants as required.
In the Field 2 field, specify a value for additional field 2 for all selected tenants, as required.
In the Street field, specify the desired street name of the address for all selected tenants.
In the ZIP Code field, specify the postal code of the address for all selected tenants.
In the Country field, specify the desired country name for the address for all selected tenants.
Enter a brief description for all selected tenants in the Comment field as required.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected tentants and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected tenants are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting Tenants
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single tenant or multiple tenants. Proceed as follows to delete existing tenants.

step.para: Switch to the Tenants view.
Select at least one tenant from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
. (Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Tenants opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Tenants, click OK to delete the selected tenants.
In the confirmation dialog Delete Tenants, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected tenants.

result.para: If the tenants have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the tenants could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed.
